name: Spicy West African Sweet Potato Soup
author: Deborah Hoermann Watt
summary: Nice spicy and rich sweet potato soup. This can be served over rice to make it last longer or for a crowd.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon ground cumin, or more to taste
5 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
1 medium jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced
2 cups vegetable broth, or as needed
½ cup peanut butter, or more to taste
1 teaspoon lime juice, or more to taste
directions: Heat oil in a stockpot over medium heat
Add onion and saute until translucent, about 5 minutes
Add garlic and ginger; cook until fragrant, about 1 minute
Add cumin, turmeric, paprika, and pepper flakes, then sweet potatoes, diced tomatoes, and jalapeno
Add enough broth to cover potatoes
Cook until potatoes are tender, 15 to 30 minutes depending on how small you cut the potatoes
Add coconut milk and peanut butter; stir
Add spinach to the top; cover and steam until tender, 2 to 3 minutes
Squeeze some lime juice over the pot or the individual bowls
